topic.title: ZeroNet and the latest Tor browser
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 0.7.1 (rev4206)
  * Operating system: Windows 10 Home
  * Web browser: Tor Browser 9.5.4 (based on Mozilla Firefox 68.12.0esr) (64-bit)
  * Tor status: Always
  * Opened port: No
  * Special configuration: None

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
All instructions reference a much older version of Tor browser, not the latest.  The latest is missing some proxy entries.  Namely the "No proxy for" option.  Is there an updated process for getting ZeroNet functioning in the latest Tor browser?  Attached screenshot for reference.    

#### Steps to reproduce:
N/A
#### Observed Results:
N/A
#### Expected Results:
N/A

![Latest Tor Browser](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70544327/91766882-de97b380-eba0-11ea-9c23-ad526129ceea.jpg)

1604068005_mirrored_MonsterB210_github.body:
Thanks for the response!

I tried going to the link you provided for the FAQ and get...

This site can’t provide a secure connection
zeronet.io sent an invalid response.
Try running Windows Network Diagnostics.
ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR

I followed the instructions you provided though.  Still not working.  Took a screenshot to show what I am seeing.

![Still errors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70544327/91916546-08c1a200-ec83-11ea-909a-5d21d585bec1.jpg)
